intro: Silene jeniseensis subsp. popovii, commonly known as the Popov's campion, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its erect, hairy stems and clusters of pink or white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils at moderate to high elevations. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered with fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in its arid environment. Silene jeniseensis subsp. popovii is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
